I think this depends on usage patterns.; ; PM (9/24/2001 10:35:46 AM); 	When a version name is the prefix of another; then the latter is a minor version of this version name  (e.g. v_128; v_128_01_pm).; ; JEM (9/24/2001 9:36:56 AM); 	Yes; but by the prefix of another do you mean separated by an underscore? The; 	problem with trying to assign meaning to major and minor version numbers is that (1) they are determined; 	by convention and (2) valid version numbers are determined by the adapter; e.g. in CVS you cant have a; 	period in the version number but you can have an underscore; so by convention underscore separates; 	major and minor version numbers.
